div.head: Vpon Monsieur de Gray, his most elaborate piece of Horsemanship and Ferriery.
div.l: THis Book's inform'd with a high Genius! this
Above the malice of detraction is!
Nor needs a friends Encomium blaze it forth,
It's proper vertue vindicates it's worth:
Yet, since, by th' Authors happy care and paine
I understood how first to use the reyne,
And menage sonipes, I could not chuse
But vent this gratefull rapture of my Muse;
How that by it he amply doth impart
The essence of the Horseman's, Ferriers Art;
So that the Horse shall to perfection grow,
And no disease his courage brave o'rethrow.
Now I will leave Pegasus aiery courses,
And sue to mount one uf his well-train'd Horses.
